intro: Epilobium congdonii, commonly known as Congdon's willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
